intro: Valeriana pubescens, commonly known as the hairy valerian, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, often fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Valeriana pubescens produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, attracting various pollinators.
